segments.text: I notice the woman at the sink, completely absorbed in her chore.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's holding the plate so gently, like it's precious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the water's overflowing right behind her, unchecked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's cascading down the cabinets, ruining everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in the puddle, and she hasn't even flinched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The daylight from the window makes the scene so bright and ordinary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet inside, it's a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Look at the boy on the stool, he's so daring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Reaching into that cookie jar with determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's watching eagerly, palm open for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool holds; it looks ready to give way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This mischief could end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems worlds away from this tension.
segments.speaker: PAR
